Auburn Hills, MI Population

The population of Auburn Hills is 24,202, according to the U.S. Census Bureau ACS estimates.

By Neilsberg Research

Updated Jun 23, 2023

Overview

24,202

Total Population

34.8

Median age

47.96%

Female population %

108.5:100

Gender ratio (M:F)

25-29 years

Largest age group

32.7

Total dependency ratio

White

Largest racial group

1,754

Hispanic population

Sources: U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey (ACS) 2021

TABLE OF CONTENTS

Age

Auburn Hills's population is young compared to the rest of the country:

The median age in Auburn Hills is 34.8, compared to 38.8 nationwide, according to the American Community Survey 2017 - 2021 5 Year estimates.

Auburn Hills's population under 18 was 13.87%, compared to the 22.51% nationwide.

Auburn Hills's elderly or the senior population (over 65 age) was 13.42% as compared to 16.04% nationwide.

Of the total population in Auburn Hills, 11.21% were under the age of 15, 28.86% aged 15 to 29, 46.51% aged 30 to 64, 12.31% aged 65 to 84, and 1.12% were 85 years of age and older.

Read more about Auburn Hills, MI population by age ➔

Gender

There are 988 less females than males in Auburn Hills:

The female percentage in the USA is 50.50% while the male percentage is 49.50%, compared to 47.96% females and 52.04% males in Auburn Hills, MI.

The Auburn Hills, MI gender ratio is 108.5:100 i.e. 108.5 men to 100 women (1.085).

For male population, the largest age group is 25-29 years with a population of 1,721.

For the female population, the largest age group is 20-24 years with a population of 1,253.

Read more about Auburn Hills, MI population by gender ➔

Race / Ethnicity

Auburn Hills's population has become increasingly diverse:

Racial distribution of Auburn Hills population: 59.03% are White, 14.66% are Black or African American, 0.25% are American Indian and Alaska Native, 16.15% are Asian, 1.84% are some other race and 8.07% are multiracial.

Auburn Hills's racial breakdown clearly shows that there is an absolute majority of White population in the city.

By ethnicity, 1,754 is Hispanic or Latino (of any race), and 22,448 (92.75% of the total population) is Non-Hispanic.

The largest racial group in Auburn Hills is White with a population of 14,286 (59.03% of the total population).

Read more about Auburn Hills, MI population by race ➔

Year by year

Auburn Hills's population has not reached its peak yet and is showing a trend of further growth:

The peak population was 25,485 in the year 2022

From 2000 to 2010, Auburn Hills's population increased by 1,173 (5.79%), as compared to the national growth of 9.63%.

From 2010 to 2020, Auburn Hills's population increased by 2,960 (13.82%), according to Census Bureau's Population Estimates Program. For the same period, the rate of growth for the United States was 7.17%.

Between the year 2000 and 2022, Auburn Hills's population was lowest in year 2000 at 20,245.

Read more about Auburn Hills, MI population by year ➔

References

U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2017-2021 5-Year Estimates

U.S. Census Bureau Population Estimates Population Estimates Program (PEP)
